instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 01700 (LR350)
threads.message:
PP3V3_G3H_T 0v 0.337
PPBUS_G3H 12.59v 0.394
PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 0v 0.269
PP1V8_G3S 0v 0.272
PP5V_G3S 0v 0.380
PP3V3_G3H_SSD0_SNS 3.38v 0.365

Cleaned corrosion around J4802 and Q5100 before readings taken.
No corrosion found elsewhere.

threads.title: 01700 (LR350)
threads.message:
Is the machine detected in DFU mode?
If not, check all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages; small coils around U7800.

threads.title: 01700 (LR350)
threads.message: I put it back together and it works fine. The touchbar cable had a small amount of corrosion and the screen sleep sensor was badly corroded. I cleaned both. The touchbar works fine, but the sleep sensor cable is damaged.
